response.original_title: Glass Bottom Ferry. On Borders and Submerged Utopias
response.overview: This audiovisual essay dives into the complexity of the border space from three European enclaves located in African territory: Ceuta, Melilla and the Canary Islands. The film plunges into the gap that unites and separates Africa and Europe, in search of the ruins and ghosts from the wreckage of the utopias that have grown on both sides: Europe as a promised land for the dispossessed South and Africa as a paradise for the exotic-hungry North.
response.title: Glass Bottom Ferry. On Borders and Submerged Utopias
